headerText: The `v-ripple` directive is used to show action from a user. It can be applied to any block level element. Numerous components come with the ripple directive built in, such as the `v-btn`, `v-tabs-item` and many more.

usage.desc: Buttons by default have ripples enabled. This can be removed with the prop `:ripple="false"`

customColor.desc: Using a helper class, you can change the color of the ripple.

tabs.desc: Tabs by default have ripples disabled. This can be enabled with the `ripple` prop.

navigationDrawers.desc: List items by default have ripples disabled. This can be enabled with the `ripple` prop

toolbars.desc: Toolbar items by default have ripples disabled. This can be enabled with the `ripple` prop.

expansionPanels.desc: Expansion panels by default have ripples disabled. This can be enabled with the `ripple` prop.

customRipple.desc: Several other components have built-in support for ripples. Enable it with the `ripple` prop.

htmlElement.desc: Add the ripple effect to a standard HTML element. This can be enabled with the `v-ripple` directive.

options.class: `v-ripple="{ "class": 'my-class' }"` Applies a custom class to the ripple, used for changing color
options.center: `v-ripple="{ "center": true }"` Force ripple to originate from the center of the target
